title: Optimizing Management Practices under Straw Regimes for Global Sustainable Agricultur... | RTCL.TV

tasks.task: Analyze the impact of straw input on soil fertility, crop yields, and greenhouse gas emissions.
subtasks: Understand the benefits of straw input on soil fertility.
Recognize the potential negative effects of improper straw input on greenhouse gas emissions.
Evaluate the effectiveness of optimal management practices in reducing greenhouse gas emissions from straw input.
Identify specific management practices that contribute to lower emissions, such as low input rates, mulching, high C/N ratio, long-term input, and no-tillage.
Assess the compatibility of these practices with maintaining crop yields and soil quality.
